title: J&J to Stop Selling Talc-Based Baby Powder Globally Next Year; Company had already switched product in U.S., Canada, citing decline in customer demand amid safety concerns
text:
J&J is facing thousands of lawsuits alleging the talc powder has harmed women who had used it for years. Some of the lawsuits have led to costly jury verdictsagainst the company.

J&J has been fighting the lawsuits and verdicts, and says its talc-containing powder is safe. The company said Thursday its position on the safety of its cosmetic talc remains unchanged.

"As part of a worldwide portfolio assessment, we have made the commercial decision to transition to an all cornstarch-based baby powder portfolio," the company said in a statement.
